div.p: I didn’t like it, school, to be honest with you. The reason why I didn’t like it is because back when I was at school in the ‘70s and ‘80s
I don’t think that the education system fully understood that some people had learning difficulties and one of the things that I have got
is dyslexia which wasn’t recognised then so when you’re at school and you couldn’t read or write people used to sort of look at you as if you
were a thick person and they used to take the mick out of you and you were bullied to be frank with you, you know when you’re sat there
in class and you can’t understand what’s in front of you and the kids around you can’t understand why you can’t understand it it was quite painful.
For somebody who’s got a learning difficulty they’ve also got a strength and I found that my strength was running so if I wanted to
get away from anything I would just get out there and just run, you know not like Forrest Gump but just run. It’s difficult to explain that
to be honest with you because there was no help there.
